title: Simple API password creation
description:
In example password is being created for 6th env. and customer setu_api:


> sudo htpasswd -c /home/ssp/sippy_web/simpleapi/.htpassword6 setu_api
New password:
Re-type new password:
Adding password for user setu_api
description_text:
In example password is being created for 6th env. and customer setu_api: 
   
 > sudo htpasswd -c /home/ssp/sippy_web/simpleapi/.htpassword6 setu_api
New password:
Re-type new password:
Adding password for user setu_api

title: Enabling simple api without authentication
description:
Please allow simple api without authentication for below Env.(i_Env=21)  http://xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx/simpleapi/available_credit.php?username=1111

sudo ee ~ssp/etc/econfig/httpd.conf:


%%IF %%I_ENVIRONMENT%% = 21
 RewriteRule ^(/simpleapi/available_credit\.php.*) $1 [L]
%%ENDIF
%%IF %%I_ENVIRONMENT%% = 21
 <Directory "/home/ssp/jvs_web/simpleapi">
    Allow from all
 </Directory>
%%ENDIF

If you need to allow simple api without authentication by HTTPS

sudo ee /usr/home/ssp/etc/econfig/httpd.conf: 


  <Directory "/home/ssp/sippy_web/simpleapi">
     RewriteEngine Off
     Options -Indexes
     #AuthType Basic
     #AuthName "Simple API"
     #AuthUserFile /home/ssp/sippy_web/simpleapi/%%HTPASSWORD%%
     #Require valid-user
   </Directory>

Allowing simple API without authentication for specific environment (by default it is allowed, you mention parameters for the case when I_ENV!=21) 


  <Directory "/home/ssp/sippy_web/simpleapi">
    RewriteEngine Off
    Options -Indexes
%%UNLESS_ENV_IN 21
    AuthType Basic
    AuthName "Simple API"
    AuthUserFile /home/ssp/sippy_web/simpleapi/%%HTPASSWORD%%
    Require valid-user
%%ENDIF
  </Directory>
description_text:
Please allow simple api without authentication for below Env.(i_Env=21)   http://xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx/simpleapi/available_credit.php?username=1111
 
 
sudo ee ~ssp/etc/econfig/httpd.conf: 
   
 %%IF %%I_ENVIRONMENT%% = 21
 RewriteRule ^(/simpleapi/available_credit\.php.*) $1 [L]
%%ENDIF
%%IF %%I_ENVIRONMENT%% = 21
 <Directory "/home/ssp/jvs_web/simpleapi">
    Allow from all
 </Directory>
%%ENDIF

 
 
If you need to allow simple api without authentication by HTTPS   
 sudo ee /usr/home/ssp/etc/econfig/httpd.conf:   
   
   <Directory "/home/ssp/sippy_web/simpleapi">
     RewriteEngine Off
     Options -Indexes
     #AuthType Basic
     #AuthName "Simple API"
     #AuthUserFile /home/ssp/sippy_web/simpleapi/%%HTPASSWORD%%
     #Require valid-user
   </Directory>

 
 
Allowing simple API without authentication for specific environment (by 
default it is allowed, you mention parameters for the case when 
I_ENV!=21)   
   
   <Directory "/home/ssp/sippy_web/simpleapi">
    RewriteEngine Off
    Options -Indexes
%%UNLESS_ENV_IN 21
    AuthType Basic
    AuthName "Simple API"
    AuthUserFile /home/ssp/sippy_web/simpleapi/%%HTPASSWORD%%
    Require valid-user
%%ENDIF
  </Directory>

title: XMLAPI troubleshoting
description:
You may use curl utility for your testing:


curl -v -k --digest -u root:msip2ua2ua -d '<?xml version="1.0"?> <methodCall> <methodName>getAccountInfo</methodName> <params> <param> <value> <struct> <member><name>i_account</name> <value><int>35926</int></value> </member> </struct></value> </param> </params> </methodCall>' https://devel.sippysoft.com/xmlapi/xmlapi | less
description_text:
You may use curl utility for your testing:
